data.title: Funeral Notices
data.meta_description: Find local and national death notices, funeral notices, obituaries, in memoriams, acknowledgements and family announcements including birthdays, births, anniversaries and marriages at funeral-notices.co.uk
data.text:
Graham LeonardHAWLEYDecember 13, 2009. Peacefully in hospital, aged 51 years. Much loved Son, Brother and Uncle. Funeral Service and Committal to be held on Wednesday, December 23 at 3.30 p.m. at Anfield Crematorium. Family flowers only please. Cheque donations welcomed in aid of Cancer Research. All enquiries and cheque donations c/o The Co-Operative Funeralcare, 2 St. Ambrose Grove, Anfield, Liverpool, L4 2RL. (Reunited with your loving Dad who you missed so much. At peace now, no more hurt. See you both soon. Forever in my heart Gray.) - Your devoted mum Marjorie xx. (You went away so suddenly, we did not say goodbye, we can never be parted, precious memories never die.) - Brokenhearted sister Barbara and husband Dave xx. (Uncle Graham, you will be deeply missed but you will be in my thoughts forever. Saturdays will never be the same. You're at peace now, love always.) - Heartbroken niece Vicky xxxxx. (Uncle Graham, we can't believe you left us so early. You will be sadly missed and you will be in our hearts and thoughts forever. Lots of love.) - Niece Louise and Neil xx. (To Great-Uncle Graham, thank you for all the times you came to visit us. You made us laugh and let us do whatever we wanted. We had great fun, we will miss you coming to see us. Our lovely "Graham Play". Lots and lots of hugs and kisses.) - Your "ickle" Millie and Daniel xx. (Rest in peace.)

Keep me informed of updates

Leave a tribute for Graham
